entry.title: The Distance Function from a Real Algebraic Variety
entry.summary: For any (real) algebraic variety $X$ in a Euclidean space $V$ endowed with a nondegenerate quadratic form $q$, we introduce a polynomial $\mathrm{EDpoly}_{X,u}(t^2)$ which, for any $u\in V$, has among its roots the distance from $u$ to $X$. The degree of $\mathrm{EDpoly}_{X,u}$ is the Euclidean Distance degree of $X$. We prove a duality property when $X$ is a projective variety, namely $\mathrm{EDpoly}_{X,u}(t^2)=\mathrm{EDpoly}_{X^{\vee},u}(q(u)-t^2)$ where $X^{\vee}$ is the dual variety of $X$. When $X$ is transversal to the isotropic quadric $Q$, we prove that the ED polynomial of $X$ is monic and the zero locus of its lower term is $X\cup(X^{\vee}\cap Q)^{\vee}$.
